subject: Version-Controlled AdaptIt Kbs (was: Re: [Read_Alphabet] A draft of Walden is up! (Finally))
msgSnippet: That s a really good idea. I m figuring out how AdaptIt writes out changes to KBs, but since they are in XML, it should work to share them between computers.
messageBody:
That's a really good idea. I'm figuring out how AdaptIt writes out changes to KBs, but since they are in XML, it should work to share them between computers. Care will have to be taken to pull before starting work, though, because computers are dumb and conflict resolution between computer-built information is easily tiring.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Nathan Sharfi <bonusfrogs@...> wrote:
>
> On Aug 18, 2013, at 8:21 PM, Timothy <tim_rice09@...> wrote:
>
> > Finally, I have put Thoreau's long-winded masterworks into Quickscript and have them up at https://sourceforge.net/projects/qs-classics/ .
> > There are likely a few mistakes, but Linus' law can apply now. Happy remixing!
>
> Have you considered putting your AdaptIt KB in a publicly-available (D)VCS? My hunch is that a bunch of the things I catch in Call of Cthulhu (still working on it) are best propagated back there
>
> I don't use AdaptIt myself (it's quite crashy on all my machines), but if I can help tune an Orthodox-to-Quikscript mapping and post diffs someplace, that'll save us all work down the line when we adapt other things.
>
>  Nathan
>
